p:
Indigofera heterantha, a common plant in the western Himalayan region, was tested for antiviral activity against HSV-2 (strain G) by Kaushik et al.
110 Hydromethanolic extracts of the root, twig, and stem of the plant were separately prepared. The root extract exhibited the strongest antiviral activity of the 3 extracts with IC 50 and SI values of 284.2 Î¼g/ml and 13.3, respectively. A subsequent study by the authors showed the extract elicits its effect early in the viral replication cycle by blocking HSV-2 attachment, adsorption, and entry into host cells.
